intro: Scleranthus condensatus, commonly known as the dense thornweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas and along roadsides. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a rough texture, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Scleranthus condensatus is an annual herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid environments.
